node.text: Who is going back to school with students this week?! 🙋🏼‍♀️ 🤗 My Getting To Know You Task Cards are my MOST popular back to school resource, and there are so many ways to use them. 🤗 Play SCOOT for the original version, use the digital version if you’re remote or just want a fun back to school project, or put up each as a slide and have students go to town discussing or writing their answers! Link in profile to download the MAJOR updates. #teach #backtoschool #teachersofinstagram #firstdayofschool #school #iteach http://bit.ly/BackToSchoolTaskCards

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mary Montero ✏️ TWAMV on August 13, 2021.

node.text: Do you require your students to restate the question in their written answers? I don’t ALL the time, but I do make sure they know how to do it and why it’s important. This free activity is always a fun one that results in many lightbulb moments! 💡 Link in profile to download it now. http://bit.ly/RestatingTheQuestion

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mary Montero ✏️ TWAMV on August 11, 2021. May be an illustration.

node.text: If ever there were a year to implement weekly (or biweekly or monthly) letter writing, this is the one. I started this tradition my first year teaching after watching my cooperating teacher faithfully do it every week while I student taught. It is so, so meaningful to students, and I have learned an incredible amount about my students by reading their letters! Link in profile to details and free information. #backtoschool #classroom #classroomtraditions #classcommunity #buildingcommunity #teach http://bit.ly/WeeklyLetterWritingHomework

node.text:
Give me a 👍 emoji if you teach math whole class or a 👏 emoji if you use small groups or a workshop model.⁣
⁣
I am often asked how I fit everything in during math... I finally sat down and detailed exactly how I set up my math block throughout the year. Read all about it via the link in my profile! #mathworkshop #math #iteachmath #mathteachers #teach #iteachelementary #iteach #iteachtoo #teachersofinstagram #teacherlife #classroom #teaching #teachergram #teachertips https://teachingwithamountainview.com/math-workshop-ideas-for-upper-elementary/

node.text: Are you ready for the first week of school? 🤗💡 My first week of school plans are a great way to get the ball rolling! Adapt them and make them your own, take bits and pieces, or just use the FREE sets of task cards that come with the document! Link in profile to read more about my first week of school and download them for free. #backtoschool #school #teacher #teachersofinstagram #iteachtoo #teacherlife #teachers #firstweekofschool #firstdayofschool #taskcards http://bit.ly/FreeFirstWeekofSchoolLessonPlans

node.text:
Is anyone else totally addicted to watching the Olympics this year!? 🙋‍♀️👀❤🏊‍♀️🤸‍♂️ Looking for the ULTIMATE Math Project after this summer of sports!? 5th grade teachers, this one is for you! The Super Sports Score Scramble is 𝙨𝙤 𝙢𝙪𝙘𝙝 𝙛𝙪𝙣 and has students scrambling to fix the scores of athletes everywhere while using their decimal place value skills!⁣
⁣
Not a 5th grade teacher? I have PLENTY of math project fun for you, too! They are all 25% off until Wednesday night ONLY! Grab them now and get prepped for the whole year. 😍 ⁣
⁣
https://bit.ly/3jgqv2R

node.text: Who here plays SCOOT with their students?! Years ago, I was at Disney riding Soarin’ (the besssst!) when I came up with the idea to play Soarin’ Through Scoot during the first few days of school. I went back to our hotel room and feverishly created this task card set, and it’s So. Much. Fun. 😆 It teaches students the basics of playing SCOOT, including what to do and what not to do… and sets the stage for the whole school year! Learn all about how to play SCOOT and download the task cards FREE via the link in my profile. https://teachingwithamountainview.com/how-to-play-scoot/
